title: Header logo asset update and logo-click login mode chooser

requirements.summary: Update the header logo to use the new static asset while keeping the brand text exactly “MyLocal Kart” and an English alt text.
acceptanceCriteria: A new logo image file exists under frontend/public/assets/generated and is used by the header logo component.
The logo image rendered in the header no longer uses /assets/generated/mylocal-kart-upload-logo.dim_256x256.png.
The visible brand text next to the logo reads exactly “MyLocal Kart”.
The logo has an English alt text that refers to “MyLocal Kart” (e.g., “MyLocal Kart Logo”).

file_operations.description: Add the required generated static logo asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/mylocal-kart-logo-v2.dim_256x256.png and ensure it is committed as a public static file.

Update the logo to use /assets/generated/mylocal-kart-logo-v2.dim_256x256.png instead of /assets/generated/mylocal-kart-upload-logo.dim_256x256.png, keep the visible brand text exactly “MyLocal Kart”, and keep an English alt text referencing “MyLocal Kart” (e.g., “MyLocal Kart Logo”).

requirements.summary: Make the header logo symbol open a Customer/Vendor login chooser when logged out, updating auth mode and triggering the existing Internet Identity login flow; hide the standalone mode selector when logged out.
acceptanceCriteria: When logged out, clicking the logo (image/symbol area) opens an on-screen UI (popover/dropdown/dialog) that shows both options: “Customer” and “Vendor”.
Selecting “Customer” or “Vendor” updates the auth mode used by the existing login flow.
The login action is available from that UI and uses the same Internet Identity login flow as the existing LoginButton.
The login chooser UI uses English labels (“Customer”, “Vendor”, and a login call-to-action in English).
The existing standalone ModeSelector in the header is removed or hidden when logged out, so the primary way to choose mode is via clicking the logo symbol.
When logged in, clicking the logo does not block normal navigation/behavior (e.g., it can behave as a home link or do nothing), and does not force a mode change.

file_operations.description: Create a small anchored chooser UI component (custom dropdown/popover UI composed in-app; do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui) that: (1) only renders/activates when logged out, (2) shows English options “Customer” and “Vendor” that call useAuthMode().setMode(...), and (3) provides an English login call-to-action that triggers the same Internet Identity login flow as the existing LoginButton by calling useInternetIdentity().login (handle loginStatus/disabled state). Include basic outside-click/escape handling so the chooser can be dismissed.

Wire the logo symbol click behavior: when not authenticated, render LogoLoginChooser so clicking the logo image/symbol opens the chooser; when authenticated, keep normal behavior and do not force a mode change. Remove or hide the standalone ModeSelector when logged out (so the primary mode selection is via clicking the logo symbol). Ensure all labels in the chooser are English.

Adjust the Logo component API as needed to allow the header to make the logo image/symbol area clickable (e.g., allow injecting an onClick handler or wrapper around the ) without changing the visible brand text. Ensure logged-in behavior does not automatically open the chooser or change mode.
